context_chunks:
Your Brain and Diabetes
KEY POINTS
Your brain is sensitive to the amount of glucose (sugar) it receives.
Diabetes can damage blood vessels in the brain and cause a stroke or memory loss.

The diabetes-brain connection
Your brain is your body's command center.

For Everyone
JULY 16, 2024 •
Diabetes
8/14/25, 9:10 PM Your Brain and Diabetes | Diabetes | CDC
https://www.cdc.gov/diabetes/diabetes-complications/effects-of-diabetes-brain.html 1/2

In the same way diabetes can damage
nerves in other parts of your body, it can damage nerves in your brain.
Diabetes affects every major organ in the body.

SOURCES
CONTENT SOURCE:
National Center for Chronic Disease Prevention and Health Promotion; Diabetes
8/14/25, 9:10 PM Your Brain and Diabetes | Diabetes | CDC
https://www.cdc.gov/diabetes/diabetes-complications/effects-of-diabetes-brain.html 2/2
Both high and low blood sugar can damage blood vessels in the brain.

These healthy habits can help you manage your
diabetes and support your brain health.

Keep brain health top of mind
You can take steps to improve or prevent problems with brain health and diabetes, such as:
Follow a healthy eating plan.

You can help protect your brain by keeping your blood sugar levels close to your
target.
High blood sugar over time damages blood vessels in the brain that carry oxygen-rich blood.

People with diabetes often develop major complications, including kidney failure, blindness, and
nerve damage.

High blood sugar
Having frequent episodes of high blood sugar (hyperglycemia) can stress the brain.
Some research shows that big dips in blood sugar may be linked to problems with depression, memory, and attention.
What about type 1 diabetes?

People with diabetes are at higher risk
for heart disease.
For example, many people with diabetes also have high blood pressure, which in turn worsens eye and kidney diseases.

KEEP READING:
Testing for Diabetes
Diabetes is harder to live with than prediabetes
People with prediabetes have a higher risk of heart disease and stroke.
To do all its work, your brain uses sugar in your blood for energy.
